quotes.quote: In life you have three options with any situation that is a challenge. Remove yourself from the situation, change it, or accept it.
It's easy to make good decisions when there are no bad options.
When there are no other options, people fight harder. If the choice is life or death they have nothing to lose.
An option hides where we don't want it to hide.
There was only one option left, and it was letting go.
There are no good options in the midst of a crisis.
When there's no clear option, it's better to do nothing.
Once the options increase, settling on one becomes harder.
You have many options in life, never make giving up one of them.
I may be running out of options, but running out isn't an option.
We have two options, medically and emotionally: give up or fight like hell.
There are only two options regarding commitment. You're either in or you're out. There's no such thing as life in-between.
You limit your options every time you don't try your best.
The option of quitting has long been undervalued and underused ... Quitters must not be frightened by the potentially cataclysmic outcome of a particular quit.
Starting off, all options are always open, but as soon as you choose something, you inevitably limit yourself. If you go for B, A is out.
You can theorise about the options you have but in reality they are very specific.
Better to be a desperate single with options than a desperate married with no options.
Options allow a woman to tailor her role to her personality, but if a man expects to provide well, he expects to wear a suit, not to wear what suits him.
Options are good. Keeps people choosing.
There are two options: adapt or die.
Choices, options, decisions abound. Choose right, take the best option and decide well.
Have you considered the option of getting the joke? If not, try it now and redeem your soul.
Freedom, privileges, options, must constantly be exercised, even at the risk of inconvenience.
You have to leave all your options open. And if you don't leave your options open, you're a fool.
The minute you realize that your options are unlimited, things just start falling into place all around you.
There are only two options for a ship: Either to sail to the sea and fight with the waves or rot in a port! The same is valid for the man!
There are really only two options - you can feel things, or you can shut down. But, once you decide to feel things, you don't get to pick and choose what you feel.
If your options are closing-in around you and you feel panicked, scared and helpless, this is the time for action.
People have to know that there are options available to us today. There is another way, and it is practical and applicable now.
Arm yourself with as many options as possible before making your next move.
